headline: Tractor Supply & Keurig Dr Pepper guidance, Mondelez downgrade
summary: Julie Hyman takes a look at the top stories of the trading day on this segment of Yahoo Finance's Market Minute. Tractor Supply (TSCO) stock falls after the retailer forecast weaker-than-expected second quarter and full-year comparable sales. Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) beat first quarter net sales expectations and reaffirmed its 2025 guidance. Mondelez International (MDLZ) was downgraded by D.A. Davidson to Neutral from Buy, citing concerns over valuation and uncertain demand. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Keurig Dr Pepper (NasdaqGS:KDP) Reports Q1 Sales of US$3,635 Million, Net Income Up
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper (NasdaqGS:KDP) announced its Q1 2025 earnings on April 24, with sales rising to $3,635 million from $3,468 million year-over-year, alongside a net income increase to $517 million. This performance, combined with a reaffirmation of its fiscal year 2025 guidance for mid-single-digit sales growth, may have bolstered the company's 12.97% stock price increase during the last quarter. While the broader market climbed modestly with the Nasdaq up 2.3% over the past week, KDP's...

headline: Keurig Dr Pepper’s (NASDAQ:KDP) Q1: Beats On Revenue
summary: Beverage company Keurig Dr Pepper (NASDAQ:KDP) reported Q1 CY2025 results topping the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 4.8% year on year to $3.64 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.42 per share was 9.8% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Keurig Dr Pepper beats profit estimates on strong U.S. demand
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper reported first-quarter revenue and profit above Wall Street expectations on Thursday, helped by strong demand for its energy drinks and beverages among U.S. consumers. WHY IT IS IMPORTANT The Snapple maker saw resilient demand for its higher-priced ready-to-drink beverages, especially in the U.S. market, fueled by new flavor variants including Dr Pepper Blackberry and Snapple Peach Tea & Lemonade. Keurig has also benefited from the popularity of energy-drink maker Ghost's products, having bought a 60% stake in October.

headline: Keurig Dr Pepper Announces Continued Evolution of its Board of Directors
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper (NASDAQ: KDP) announced changes today as part of the continued evolution of its Board of Directors. The Company shared the appointments of two highly accomplished executives – Mike Van de Ven and Lawson Whiting – as directors. The Company also announced that Bob Gamgort's role has progressed from Executive Chairman to non-executive Chairman of the Board. These moves are effective today, April 24, 2025.
